org.gridfour.io

Class BitInputStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gridfour.io.BitInputStore

  • public class BitInputStore
extends Object
    Writes a series of bits to an internal memory buffer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitInputStore(byte[] input)
      Construct a reader that will extract bits from the specified input.
      BitInputStore(byte[] input, int offset, int length)
      Construct a reader that will extract bits from the specified input.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBit()
      Gets a single bit to the bit-writer content.
      int getBits(int nBitsInValue)
      Gets the specified number of bits from the context
      int getPosition()
      Gets the current bit position within the input store.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitInputStore

        public BitInputStore(byte[] input)
        Construct a reader that will extract bits from the specified input.
        Parameters:
        input - a valid array of bytes storing the content.

      • BitInputStore

        public BitInputStore(byte[] input,
                     int offset,
                     int length)
        Construct a reader that will extract bits from the specified input.
        Parameters:
        input - a valid array of bytes storing the content.
        offset - the starting offset within the input
        length - the number of bytes from the input that are valid; it is assumed that input is at least length+offset bytes long.

    • Method Detail

      • getBit

        public int getBit()
        Gets a single bit to the bit-writer content.
        Returns:
        a value of 1 or 0

      • getBits

        public int getBits(int nBitsInValue)
        Gets the specified number of bits from the context
        Parameters:
        nBitsInValue - number of bits in the range 1 to 32.
        Returns:
        a valid integer value composed using the specified number of bits from the content.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Gets the current bit position within the input store. This is the position from which the next bit will be read.
        Returns:
        a value of zero or greater.
